intro: Phorolobus crispus, commonly known as the hairy phorolobus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Phorolobus crispus is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils.
